So today is a very significant day in the lives of the devotees who are taking Diksha initiation.
When we are taking initiation from Srila Prabhupada,
we are accepting Srila Prabhupada as our Diksha Guru, initiating spiritual master,
and Prabhupada is also accepting you as his disciple.
It is important to understand what Diksha is, what is initiation.
In the Chaitanya Charitamrita, Madhyalila, Chapter 4, Chapter 24, verse 333, purport,
Srila Prabhupada says that,
as far as Diksha is concerned, initiation is concerned,
one must refer the Chaitanya Charitamrita, Madhyalila, Chapter 15, verse 108.
So in that purport to verse 108 of Chapter 15 of the Chaitanya Charitamrita, Madhyalila,
Srila Prabhupada elaborately explains about Diksha or initiation.
Srila Prabhupada quotes Srila Rupa Goswami and he says that,
divyam jnanam yathodadyat kuryat papasya sankshayam,
diksheti sa chokta deshikais tatva kovidaihi.
What is the definition of Diksha?
The definition of Diksha, the word Diksha is taken from two words,
di is taken from divya jnana,
and ksha is taken from kuryat papasya sankshayam, kshaya.
So divyam jnanam yathodadyat,
the process by which transcendental knowledge is revealed within the heart,
divyam jnanam yathodadyat.
Kuryat papasya sankshayam,
and by the process by which sinful reactions are destroyed in one's lives.
These two things constitute the process of Diksha.
So all of you who are taking Diksha today,
you have already received divya jnana in your heart to some extent.
The day you came in touch with devotees and somebody gave you a book of Prabhupada
and you started reading Prabhupada's books,
divya jnana started revealing within your hearts, isn't it?
So the process of divya jnana, of Diksha started the day
when you started hearing from Srila Prabhupada.

you might have begun with chanting Hare Krishna Maha Mantra

you increase your number of malas,

Papa or the sinful reactions in our life are of two kinds.
One is the propensity to perform sinful activities

because of our ignorance.

that thinking that I am the body,
I am not a spirit soul,

which is the result of sinful activities
in our past lives.

the way the sinful reactions manifest

and when we speak of suffering
on account of our accumulated sinful activities,
reactions in our past lives,
it again manifests in two types.
One is Prarabdha Karma

Prarabdha Karma means
the results which are already manifested.
This body which I have got

It is Prarabdha Karma.
I have got a certain mind and intelligence

I might be suffering from some disease

That means it is already manifest.
I am already,
I am already either enjoying or suffering
the fruit of my past activity.
The second type of sinful reaction is
Aprarabdha Karma.
Aprarabdha Karmam Kutam Bijam Falon Mukam.

One is,
it is in seed form.
Another is sprouting.
Another is the fruit
which is not yet ripe.

when the sinful reactions in our life

when we,
when,
